data.event: Taba was located on the Egyptian side of the armistice line agreed to in 1949.

event.title: 1956 it was briefly occupied but returned

data.event: During the Suez Crisis in 1956 it was briefly occupied but returned to Egypt when Israel withdrew in 1957.
During the Suez Crisis in 1956 it was briefly occupied but returned to Egypt when Israel withdrew in 1957.

event.title: reoccupied the Sinai Peninsula after the Six-Day War in 1967

data.event: Israel reoccupied the Sinai Peninsula after the Six-Day War in 1967, and subsequently a 400-room hotel was built in Taba.

event.title: 1973 Yom-Kippur War, when Egypt and Israel were negotiating

data.event: Following the 1973 Yom-Kippur War, when Egypt and Israel were negotiating the exact position of the border in preparation for the 1979 peace treaty, Israel claimed that Taba had been on the Ottoman side of a border agreed between the Ottomans and British Egypt in 1906 and had, therefore, been in error in its two previous agreements.

Following the 1973 Yom-Kippur War, when Egypt and Israel were negotiating the exact position of the border in preparation for the 1979 peace treaty, Israel claimed that Taba had been on the Ottoman side of a border agreed between the Ottomans and British Egypt in 1906 and had, therefore, been in error in its two previous agreements.

event.title: agreed between the Ottomans and British Egypt in 1906

data.event: Following the 1973 Yom-Kippur War, when Egypt and Israel were negotiating the exact position of the border in preparation for the 1979 peace treaty, Israel claimed that Taba had been on the Ottoman side of a border agreed between the Ottomans and British Egypt in 1906 and had, therefore, been in error in its two previous agreements.
Although most of Sinai was returned to Egypt in 1982, Taba was the last portion to be returned.
In 1988, the commission ruled in Egypt's favour, and Israel returned Taba to Egypt in February 1989.

event.title: returned Taba to Egypt in February 1989

data.event: In 1988, the commission ruled in Egypt's favour, and Israel returned Taba to Egypt in February 1989.
